alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 1:59AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherry and eastern Sheridan Counties through 145 AM MDT... At 1258 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Gordon to 15 miles northwest of Ashby. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cody, Merriman, Medicine Lake, Speckel Meir Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Eli, Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Morgan Lake, Irwin, Schoolhouse Lake, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Hoover Lake, Round Lake and Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 111 and 161. Highway 61 between mile markers 176 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
